data.title: The Animals U.S. Concerts & More
data.meta_description: The British Invasion Remembered! Well before I started this blog, I had my rather ramshackle British Invasion blog site. Then, after a few years, I started PopBopRockTilUDrop and merged the two sites. I haven't spent a lot of time since then on the British U.S. Invasion. So, I have decided to occasionally tip my hat…
data.text:
The British Invasion Remembered!

Well before I started this blog, I had my rather ramshackle British Invasion blog site. Then, after a few years, I started PopBopRockTilUDrop and merged the two sites. I haven’t spent a lot of time since then on the British U.S. Invasion. So, I have decided to occasionally tip my hat to Brits who first made their way to our shores!

The Animals would let us know that there was going to be more to the British Invasion than we first realized. When I first heard “House of the Rising Sun”, the group with the great bluesy lead singer got my attention!

The Animals grew out of the Newcastle band “The Alan Price Rhythm & Blues Combo” with Price, Eric Burdon, Hilton Valentine, John Steel and Bryan ‘Chas’ Chandler being the originals.

The band arrived in the U.S., landing in New York in September of 1964 embarking on their first North American tour including their first appearance on the Ed Sullivan Show.

The first original member to depart was keyboard player Price who left in the spring of 1965 due to some personal differences and also his fear of flying. By late 1966 the lineup had pretty much been revamped and the group became known as “Eric Burdon and the Animals”.

Over time there have been nearly two dozen Animals pass through the ranks.

Chas Chandler died in 1996 – Valentine died in 2021

The Animals U.K. Discography

The Animals U.S. Discography

Eric Burdon Beyond the Animals Discography
